TEXT: The applicant is the borough council of a town in the region of GPE . It was represented before the court by PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

ORG said that it had been the owner of the castle situated in the town from time immemorial . There was evidence in the form of instruments disposing of municipal rights or interests in the castle dating back to DATE and since DATE ORG had been registered in the cadastral register as the owner of the castle .

During the Spanish Civil War in DATE the archives of ORG were destroyed in a fire . After the civil war , in DATE , PERSON , a member of the influential family of ORG , had her name entered in the new register as the owner of “ a very old castle and its external walls , all in an appalling state of ruin and destruction ” , on the ground that she had inherited the property in DATE from her mother .

In DATE the heirs of the ORG of Pidal brought an action before the LOC district judge no . CARDINAL against ORG for a declaration that they had title to the castle . In a judgment of DATE the district judge found in their favour and declared that the property in the castle was vested in them .

ORG appealed to the LOC provincial , which , in a decision of DATE delivered after an adversarial hearing , overturned the judgment of the district judge . It accepted ORG plea that it had acquired title by adverse possession since DATE and dismissed the claimants’ action . The heirs of the PERSON of Pidal appealed on points of law to ORG which , by a judgment of DATE , overturned the decision of the Audiencia provincial , and upheld the judgment of the district judge .
Relying on LAW ( right to a fair trial ) , ORG lodged an amparo appeal with ORG . The appeal was dismissed on DATE , as being manifestly ill - founded .
